metadata.Title: CVE-2019-17539 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In FFmpeg before 4.2, avcodec_open2 in libavcodec/utils.c allows a NULL pointer dereference and possibly unspecified other impact when there is no valid close function pointer.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17539` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:3.4.8-0ubuntu0.2
libavcodec-extra - 7:3.4.8-0ubuntu0.2
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:3.4.8-0ubuntu0.2
libavcodec57 - 7:3.4.8-0ubuntu0.2
libavdevice57 - 7:3.4.8-0ubuntu0.2
libavfilter-extra - 7:3.4.8-0ubuntu0.2
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:3.4.8-0ubuntu0.2
libavfilter6 - 7:3.4.8-0ubuntu0.2
libavformat57 - 7:3.4.8-0ubuntu0.2
libavresample3 - 7:3.4.8-0ubuntu0.2
libavutil55 - 7:3.4.8-0ubuntu0.2
libpostproc54 - 7:3.4.8-0ubuntu0.2
libswresample2 - 7:3.4.8-0ubuntu0.2
libswscale4 - 7:3.4.8-0ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: ebarretto> This issue was caused by b1febda0619 The above commit was never integrated to 2.8.x but for 3.4, it was both integrated and fixed in 3.4.7, so letting bionic version marked as needed.

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7:3.4.8-0ubuntu0.2').
